Database
Class DatabaseController

java.lang.Object
  Database.DatabaseController

public class DatabaseController
extends java.lang.Object

The DatabaseController class handles all user data storage by implementing the SQLite library. The methods in this class use SQL queries to read,update,delete,and create entries from a table inside the database. When appropriate, the methods in this class use the username of a user as the key to access all other entries in the database corresponding to that username. All methods involving database connections will automatically terminate their connections following execution.

Method Detail

initializeDatabase

public static void initializeDatabase()
                               throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Initializes the database, and inserts a table used to store user data. Contains fields: username, password, real name, high-score, level unlocked and number of games played. Connections are closed after statements execute.

Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

dropDatabaseTable

public static void dropDatabaseTable()
                              throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Drops the tables present in the database. All data in the tables will be lost.

Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

createNewUser

public static boolean createNewUser(java.lang.String userName,
                                    java.lang.String pass,
                                    java.lang.String rName)
                             throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Inserts a new user into the database table "Users". The boolean returns true if a user was successfully inserted, and false if it was not successful.

Parameters:
userName - A string representing the specified username for the user entry.
pass - A string representing the specified password for the user entry.
rName - A string representing the specified real name for the user entry.
Returns:
Returns true if the user insertion operation was successful, false if it was not succesful.
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

createDirectoryForUserSavedFiles

public static void createDirectoryForUserSavedFiles(java.lang.String username)
Creates a directory savedgames where saved game data is stored.

Parameters:
username - A string representing the name of the folder to be created, where the user's saved game files will be stored. Corresponds to the user's username.

authenticateUser

public static boolean authenticateUser(java.lang.String Uname,
                                       java.lang.String pass)
                                throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Authenticates a user by querying the database for a specified username and password.

Parameters:
Uname - A string representing the specified username of the user to be authenticated.
pass - A string representing the specified password of the user to be authenticated.
Returns:
Boolean returns true if the user was succesfully authenticated (user exists in the user_data.db table, and username/password match). Returns false otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

deleteAccount

public static boolean deleteAccount(java.lang.String username)
                             throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Removes all the fields in the database table associated to a username.

Parameters:
username - A string representing the username of a user, for which all fields should be deleted.
Returns:
Boolean returns true if the deletion was successful (all fields corresponding to the username removed from the table). Returns false otherwise.

java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

setScore

public static void setScore(java.lang.String username,
                            int score)
                     throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Adds a specified score to the existing score of a user in the database, as specified by the username upon which setScore() is called. The score for a given user is culmulative.

Parameters:
username - A string representing the username of which the specified score is to be added to the existing score.
score - An int representing the score of which the corresponding user's score field in the database is to be incremented by.
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

getTopScoresSet

public static java.util.ArrayList<PlayerScore> getTopScoresSet()
                                                        throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Creates an arraylist of type PlayerScore, populated by PlayerScore objects corresponding to all users in the database. The arraylist is sorted by score, in descending order.

Returns:
Returns an arraylist populated with PlayerScore objects corresponding to all users in the database sorted by score in descending order.
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
